#6999D5#Increase Shield Capacity of every Ship on Flotilla#REVERT#

Ships get a damage bonus proportional to their current manpower compared to their maximum manpower. If a ship has maximum manpower, it gets 20% Damage bonus. If a ship no manpower, it doesn't get any bonuses.

Every Ship Class has a unique Targeting Priority ordering depending on Targeting Weight of the enemy ship. Jammers reduce the Targeting Weight of a ship thus lowering the ships chance to be targeted. When this module is used on military ships, it ensures the ship is targeted last.

Every Ship Class has a unique Targeting Priority ordering depending on Targeting Weight of the enemy ship. Jammers reduce the Targeting Weight of a ship thus lowering the ships chance to be targeted. When this module is used on any ship (including Behemoths), it ensures the ship is targeted last.

Every Ship Class has a unique Targeting Priority ordering depending on Targeting Weight of the enemy ship. Lensers increase the Targeting Weight of a ship thus increasing the ships chance to be targeted. When used on a military ship, it ensures the ship is targeted first.

Every Ship Class has a unique Targeting Priority ordering depending on Targeting Weight of the enemy ship. Lensers increase the Targeting Weight of a ship thus increasing the ships chance to be targeted. When used on any ship, it ensures the ship is targeted first.

Swarm Missiles fire many missiles in short bursts. Their purpose is to break through enemy flak defenses. Swarm missile bursts fire before other missiles, ensuring maximum protection against enemy flak defense. Using better versions, increases the missile count on each burst and subsequently determines whether none or all of your missiles reach their target.

Firing simultaneously with its host Kinetic weapon, Flak targets incoming projectiles, Squadrons and Boarding Pods. Flak completely counters equal amounts of same tier missiles. Increasing the total amount of flak in your flotilla also indirectly increases the effectiveness of each flak module resulting in even better defense against missiles and drop pods.
For opponent fleet:
-25% Defense and Damage on Fleet
Crew Defense Protocol
Ships defenses focus on saving the life of the crew, leaving the hulls itself susceptible to damage.
-15% Damage, Accuracy and Evasion on Fleet
For both fleets: -50% Shield and Health regeneration on Ships

Every Ship Class has a unique Targeting Priority ordering depending on Targeting Weight of the enemy ship. Soft targets inverts this targeting order thus enemy ships with the least weight are targeted first.
Inverts the targeting priority of the ships.
Improves effects of morale bonus which increases the damage, accuracy and evasion of your ships when enemy has fewer active flotillas.
Shield regeneration per second
Manpower Damage Absorption
The role of this ship is to inflict massive damage on the enemy. Primary targets: Protector and then Coordinator ships Secondary targets: Carrier ships
The role of this ship is to inflict massive damage on the enemy. Primary targets: Protector and then Coordinator ships Secondary targets: Carrier ships
The role of this ship is to protect other ships in battle. Primary targets: Attacker and then Hunter ships Secondary targets: Protector and Coordinator ships
The role of this ship is to protect or assist other ships in battle. Primary targets: Attacker and Hunter ships Secondary targets: Protector and Coordinator ships

This type of ship is bound to a Hero. Â All [commandPoint] (Command Points) cost are cancelled. Hero ships are targeted by enemy ships as if they are Attacker class. Primary targets: Medium sized ships Secondary targets: Large sized ships

Juggernauts are targeted first by military ships. The Juggernaut is the biggest and strongest ship in the galaxy. It can be embedded in fleets and can be further upgraded, either by having more slots, or by unlocking the Ion Wave, a powerful ability which damages all fleets present on the node.
Behemoths are targeted first by military ships. Behemoth roles vary depending on the Modules you equip them with. They can focus on economic, scientific, or military capacities.
Battle Card Slot Increase
Medium-sized ships require #E3BDAC#3#REVERT# [commandPoint] (Command Points) of their fleet. Hull Weakness: #E3BDAC#300#REVERT# (see defense absorption)
Large-sized ships require #E3BDAC#6#REVERT# [commandPoint] (Command Points) of their fleet. Hull Weakness: #E3BDAC#700#REVERT# (see defense absorption)
Only one Lock-on module can be equipped.
Only one Re-Shield module can be equipped.
Only one Fleet repair module can be equipped.
Only one Strike Multiplier can be equipped.
Only one Squadron Shifter can be equipped.
Only one Shrapnel module can be equipped.

You were once on the planet, so it must be out there somewhere! Use your scouts scattered across the galaxy to dig out the secrets of Auriga's past. And, more importantly, Auriga's present.
Search $Amount01Name Curiosities to find Auriga.
The Exploration ship must have probes installed to perform the investigation of a curiosity.
Powerful repulsive forces flex across the surface of the rift. Huge quantities of Strategic Resources will be needed to overcome them, and that's not even mentioning the cost of the whole enterprise.

Explore the Quest Curiosity on Vanguard when you're ready to sacrifice $Amount01Name [Strat01titaniumColored] Titanium, $Amount01Name [Strat02hyperiumColored] Hyperium, $Amount01Name [Strat03adamantianColored] Adamantian, $Amount01Name [Strat04anti-matterColored] Antimatter, $Amount01Name [Strat05orichalcixColored] Orichalcix, $Amount01Name [Strat06quadrinixColored] Quadrinix.
The amassed Strategics Resources will be deducted from your Empire Dust reserves when the Curiosity is explored.

Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 2x [explorer]

Can splice the genetic material of other factions to enhance its population. Splicing requires the sacrifice of some individuals.
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 1x [explorer]

A science bonus is given for discovering technologies based on how many players have already researched it: the fewer know it, the higher the reduction on the next research.
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 1x [explorer]

Can use Influence to buyout star system Improvements, research technologies and purchase resources on the marketplace.
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 1x [explorer]

Can build Singularities, and affect time by placing them on a system. Singularities have a fixed duration and can only be placed on a system within the empire's vision
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 1x [explorer]
Population must be built with [industryColored], cannot be boosted.

Can use their ships to expand their "tendrils" to adjacent systems. When a system is "anchored" Â this way they can colonize it, or let it provide bonuses (Approval and Population growth) to friends.Â Also grants a +1000Â defensive bonus to their Home System.
Starting Ships: 1x [unfallen], 1x [explorer]

Use [lifeforceColored], a unique resource, to generate population and create Arks. Arks are used to colonize and develop systems, and can be moved at any time.
Starting Ships: 1x [vampirilis], 2x [lifeforce], 1x [explorer]

Use [dustColored] to colonize instead of colonizers. Can negotiate/trade outposts using diplomacy
Starting Ships: 2x [explorer]

Every Colony can build a Portal that permits instantaneous travel to any other gate in the empire.Â Ships will automatically use gates to plot the most efficient route between any two Systems.
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 1x [explorer]

Can accumulate Keii and use it to launch Keii actions to boost the military and production capacities of systems. Keii also determines empire and system Obedience, which replaces Approval. +40% [honorColored] gain after a space battle under the Keii zone of Behemoths.
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 1x [explorer]

Possesses a hiddenÂ Home System,Â located on a special node, that can be migrated to another special node for a cost. Cannot colonize SystemsÂ in the normal fashion, but is able to place hidden Sanctuaries on planets. Can abduct Sleeper agents from enemy populations to bring them back to the Home System as enhanced populations. Umbral Choir are immune to influence conversion; however their ships can be attacked in Cold War even when on their Home System.
Starting Ships: 2x [explorer]

Can collect Relics. Unassigned Relics produce science. Can assign Relics to heroes for new skills or to Empire for economic bonuses Can create and interact with Temples planetary specialization. Temples allow ceding adjacent Systems to the Academy in exchange for Relics and a permanent tithe (income). Systems converted to the Academy count as your Systems for the purpose of Conquest Victory
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 2x [explorer]
